DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Events Domain Specimen Reference Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The human-readable ID that is pre-printed on the specimen label (provided to the site).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Events Domain Biospecimen Reference ID
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An events domain that documents biospecimen collection and storage information._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A sequence of characters that represents a reference identification.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
A sequence of characters that represents a reference identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
